Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.client.view.cli

Class CLIHelper

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.client.view.cli.CLIHelper
public class CLIHelper
extends java.lang.Object
Class that contains utility to draw better Command Line Interfaces.

    CLIHelper​(int height, UICache cache)

  • Constructor Details

    • CLIHelper

      CLIHelper​(UICache cache)
      Setup a graphic space that will act like a buffer for what will be printed in stdout later on, allowing a greater control on shapes and layout. If not height and width is specified, assume the default 80x24 on the terminal.
      Parameters:
      cache - ref to the local UICache

    • CLIHelper

      CLIHelper​(int height, UICache cache)
      Setup a graphic space that will act like a buffer for what will be printed in stdout later on, allowing a greater control on shapes and layout.
      Parameters:
      height - the height of the window
      cache - ref to the local UICache

  • Method Details

    • initCanvas

      private void initCanvas()

    • reset

      private void reset()
      Reset the canvas to an empty state. It's good habit to call it straight after print() in order to prevent glitches.

    • addRect

      private void addRect​(int x, int y, int w, int h)
      Draw an ASCII rect on the canvas
      Parameters:
      x - horizontal start position
      y - vertical start position
      w - width
      h - height

    • addLine

      private void addLine​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Draw a horizontal or vertical line. Lines that aren't horizontal or vertical won't be drawn.
      Parameters:
      x1 - start x
      y1 - start y
      x2 - end x
      y2 - end y

    • addText

      private void addText​(int x, int y, java.lang.String text, CLIColor color)
      Add a text label of variable size to the canvas. Overflowing text will be hidden.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      text - the input text
      color - the color of the text (default: RESET)

    • refresh

      private void refresh()
      Fix graphic glitches and prepare the canvas for rendering.

    • getSymbol

      private char getSymbol​(int x, int y)
      This method returns the correct ASCII symbol for borders according to neighbouring cells.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate
      y - y coordinate
      Returns:
      an ASCII symbol

    • print

      public void print()
      Print the canvas to the standard output

    • clear

      public static void clear()
      Handle the cleaning of the console on windows and other OSs.
      See Also:
      Stackoverflow: Clear the console

    • drawBoard

      private void drawBoard()
      Draw the board with the workers and builds

    • drawCell

      private void drawCell​(int x, int y, UICell cell)
      Draw a cell in 4 chars of space. The first char will be the height of the tower, the second char will be a "D" if the tower has a dome, else it will be " ". The third char is whether there's a worker on the cell, marked by "W", else it will be " ", and the last one is an ID for the player.
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate
      y - coordinate
      cell - The cell

    • drawList

      public void drawList​(int x, int y, int w, int h, java.util.List<java.lang.String> list, java.util.List<CLIColor> colors)
      Display a list that splits in two columns if list.size() is greater than height
      Parameters:
      x - start
      y - start
      w - width
      h - height
      list - list of choices
      colors - colors associated with the choices - set null if you want standard text

    • drawBoardAndPlayers

      public void drawBoardAndPlayers()
      Draw the board with the player list aside

    • drawPanelChoices

      public void drawPanelChoices​(java.lang.String title, java.util.List<java.lang.String> choices)
      Draw options on the right side of the map/board. This will be useful for either workers or actions.
      Parameters:
      choices - list of strings representing the entries.
      title - the title to display

    • drawMessageFullscreen

      public void drawMessageFullscreen​(java.lang.String text)
      Add a text at the top of the screen. Reset and print included.
      Parameters:
      text - the message

    • drawListFullscreen

      public void drawListFullscreen​(java.lang.String title, java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
      Draw a list with a heading fullscreen. The entries will have a prefix starting from 1.
      Parameters:
      title - Prompt at the top
      list - List of choices (strings).

    • drawMessage

      public void drawMessage​(java.lang.String text)
      Send a single message to the user
      Parameters:
      text - text to be drawn
